title: Abderrazek Chebbi
text:
Abderrazek Chebbi (; born 9 February 1962) is a Tunisian <a href="association%20football">football</a> coach and former player who played for <a href="%C3%89toile%20du%20Sahel">Étoile du Sahel</a>. He is the current manager of Saudi Pro League club <a href="Abha%20Club">Abha</a>.
Career.
He spent his whole playing career with <a href="%C3%89toile%20du%20Sahel">Étoile du Sahel</a> and made his debut in the early 1980s. He retired in 1990 and was made assistant manager in 1990. In 1995, he won the <a href="1995%20CAF%20Cup">1995 CAF Cup</a> as the assistant manager of Brazilian coach <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Dutra%20dos%20Santos">Dutra</a>. He was then named as the manager of <a href="ES%20Hammam-Sousse">ES Hammam-Sousse</a> in 2001 before to Qatar to manage <a href="Al-Rayyan%20SC">Al-Rayyan</a> in 2002.
On 26 December 2004, Chebbi was named as the manager of <a href="Al-Jabalain%20FC">Al-Jabalain</a>. This would the first of many Saudi clubs he would take charge of. His first match ended in a 2–1 defeat against <a href="Al-Raed%20FC">Al-Raed</a> on 29 December 2004. In his first season, Chebbi guided Al-Jabalain to a ninth-placed finish 9 points clear of relegation. Chebbi's contract was renewed for another year on 13 August 2005. In his second season, Al-Jabalain managed to finish seventh two positions and two points more than what they changed last season. On 29 April 2006, <a href="Al-Ansar%20FC%20%28Medina%29">Al-Ansar</a> announced that they had hired Chebbi as their new manager. On 23 February 2007, Chebbi was sacked after a run of 10 league games without a win. He also led the club to the final of the Prince Faisal Cup losing to Al-Raed in the final. On 7 March 2007, Chebbi returned to Al-Jabalain on a contract that lasted until the end of the season. Chebbi managed to save the club from relegation and finished 12th just two points above the relegation zone.
On 10 November 2007, <a href="Al-Faisaly%20FC">Al-Faisaly</a> announced that they had hired Chebbi on a contract that lasted until the end of the season. On 17 January 2008, during a training session, Chebbi injured one of his ligaments in his foot and underwent surgery. On 16 February 2008, Chebbi resigned as manager of Al-Faisaly due to his rehabilitation process. On 3 October 2008, Chebbi signed a one-year contract to manage <a href="Al-Qadsiah%20FC">Al-Qadsiah</a>. On 7 May 2009, Chebbi lead Al-Qadsiah to the 2008–09 <a href="Saudi%20First%20Division">Saudi First Division</a> title and promotion to the <a href="Saudi%20Professional%20League">Pro League</a>. Despite leading the club to promotion, his contract wasn't renewed at the end of the season. On 31 May 2009, Chebbi signed a contract to manage <a href="Al-Taawoun%20FC">Al-Taawoun</a>. On 1 January 2010, Chebbi was sacked by Al-Taawoun after a run of six league games without a win. On 5 January 2011, Chebbi signed a six-month contract with <a href="Khaleej%20FC">Al-Khaleej</a>. On 22 October 2011, <a href="Al-Watani">Al-Watani</a> announced Chebbi as their new manager until the end of the season. On 20 March 2012, Chebbi was sacked by Al-Watani. On 26 November 2012, Chebbi returned to Tunisia to manage <a href="ES%20Hammam-Sousse">ES Hammam-Sousse</a>. On 10 January 2013, he resigned as manager due to disagreements with the board.
On 6 February 2013, Chebbi returned to Saudi Arabia to manage <a href="Sdoos%20Club">Sdoos</a> until the end of the season. Despite his best efforts, Chebbi could not prevent Sdoos' relegation to the Second Division. On 7 August 2013, Chebbi returned to manage Al-Qadsiah. On 11 February 2014, Chebbi was sacked. On 28 February 2014, Chebbi replaced Egyptian manager <a href="Mohamed%20Salah%20%28football%20manager%29">Mohamed Salah</a> as manager of <a href="Al-Wehda%20Club%20%28Mecca%29">Al-Wehda</a> until the end of the season. On 13 November 2014, Chebbi signed a contract until the end of the season with <a href="Al-Fayha%20FC">Al-Fayha</a> to replace fellow Tunisian manager <a href="Ahmed%20Labyad">Ahmed Labyad</a>. At the time of his appointment, Al-Fayha sat at the bottom of the table. Chebbi managed to steer Al-Fayha out of the relegation and finish 11th. His contract wasn't renewed at the end of the season.
On 18 December 2015, Chebbi was appointed as the manager of <a href="Al-Riyadh%20SC">Al-Riyadh</a>. Al-Riyadh won only 1 out of 14 matches and sat at the bottom of the table. Despite his best efforts, Chebbi could not prevent Al-Riyadh's relegation to the Second Division. On 29 November 2016, Chebbi was appointed as the manager of <a href="Al-Qaisumah%20FC">Al-Qaisumah</a>. On 2 July 2017, Chebbi renewed his contract with Al-Qaisumah for a further year. On 13 June 2018, Chebbi was appointed as the manager of <a href="Abha%20Club">Abha</a>. On 11 May 2019, Chebbi lead Abha to their first <a href="Prince%20Mohammad%20bin%20Salman%20League">MS League</a> title and promotion to the Pro League. On 9 May 2019, Chebbi renewed his contract with Abha for a further year. On 11 February 2020, he renewed his contract with the club for another year.
Honours.
Player.
Étoile du Sahel
Manager.
Al-Qadsiah
Abha
Individual
